description: CONVERSION OF A 3 BEDROOM HOUSE TO 2 FLATS ENTAILING 1x2 BEDROOM FLAT AND 1x3 BEDROOM FLAT, INCLUDING THE ERECTION OF A REAR EXTENSION AND A REAR DORMER EXTENSION. FRONT GARDEN TO DRIVEWAY CONVERSION AND OTHER ASSOCIATED WORKS.
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposal, by reason of layout, including substandard room dimensions, and inadequate gross internal floor area and lack of external amenity space for the upper floor flat, would fail to provide suitable living conditions for future occupiers of both the ground floor and first floor flat. As such, the proposal would be contrary to Merton Local Development Framework Core Strategy (July 20110 policy CS14 d(a) & b(ii), London Plan policy 3.5 and the Technical Housing standards 2015.

Reason : 2 - The proposed roof extension, by reason of its brick materials, would result in a visually incongruous development that would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the host dwelling and the local area. The proposal therefore contrary to the principles of London Plan policies 7.4 and 7.6, Core Strategy policy CS14 and SPP Policies DMD2 and DMD3.

Reason : 3 - The proposed ground floor rear extension by reason of its scale and sitting would be overbearing form when viewed from the adjoining property at 55 Morden Road and would also have an undue impact toward their daylight and sunlight. Therefore, the proposal would be contrary to London Plan (2016) Policies 7.4 and 7.6, Merton's Core Strategy Policy (2011) CS14 and Merton's Sites and Policies Plan (2014) DMD2 and DMD3.

Reason : 4 - The proposal fails to demonstrate that policy compliant carbon dioxide reductions and water consumption reductions can be achieved so as to make the fullest contribution to climate change mitigation and to ensure that water usage in London is sustainable. The proposal would therefore be contrary to London Plan 2016 Policy 5.2 and 5.15 and policy CS 15 of Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011).

Reason : 5 - INFORMATIVE

Refused Drawings - 
0053-GUA-XX-XX-DR-A-2000-P2; 0053-GUA-XX-XX-DR-A-1110-P3; 0053-GUA-XX-XX-DR-A-3000-P2; Site Location Plan

Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
